Place the person on a flat, firm surface and kneel beside them.
Place the heel of one hand on the center of the chest, and your other hand on top, interlocking your fingers.
Push hard and fast at a depth of about 2 inches (5 cm) at a rate of 100-120 compressions per minute.
If trained, give 2 rescue breaths after every 30 compressions: tilt the head back, pinch the nose shut, and blow into their mouth.
Continue CPR until emergency help arrives or the person shows signs of life.

Stand behind them and wrap your arms around their waist.
Make a fist with one hand and place it just above their navel.
Grasp your fist with the other hand and deliver quick, upward abdominal thrusts.
Repeat until the object is expelled, or the person becomes unconscious.
If they lose consciousness, lay them on the ground and start CPR, checking for the object before giving breaths.
